Many also offer reminders, insulin dosing calculations, and analytics to identify trends.

**Connected Glucometers and Insulin Pumps**: Some modern glucometers and insulin pumps come with Bluetooth connectivity or mobile apps, making it easy to send reports to healthcare teams and stay on top of medication schedules.
** Wearable Devices**: Continuous glucose monitors (CGMs) and smart insulin pumps offer real-time tracking of blood sugar levels, minimizing the need for manual finger stick checks.

**Blood Glucose Monitoring (BGM) Devices**: Wireless BGM devices, such as those produced by Dexcom and Abbott, enable users to continuously measure glucose levels throughout the day without having to manually take fingerprick readings.

**Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) Wearables**: Wearables like FreeStyle LibreLink, Omnipod DASHPump, and Senseonics CGMs offer real-time continuous glucose monitoring, providing valuable insights into sugar patterns and trends.
**Connected Insulin Pens and Pumps**: Devices such as InPen, ConnectedLife’s SmartPen, and Medtronic MiniMed 670G allow users to track insulin dosing schedules, amount injected, and receive alerts.

**Personalized Health Analytics**: AI-powered systems like IBM Watson and Google DeepMind analyze medical records, lifestyle, and sensor data to identify patterns and provide personalized advice on food choices, medication, and self-care regimens.
